ap_title: Integrated stop smoking services across the Local Maternity System
ap_text: Integrated stop smoking services across the Sussex and East Surrey Local Maternity System
success: Maternity partners across the Sussex and East Surrey Local Maternity System work together to enhance integrated stop smoking support for mothers and families.
hic_label: Working in partnership is the building block for success

ap_title: Pilot project 'Actively Quitting' using physical activity as a diversion
ap_text: Pilot project 'Actively Quitting' using physical activity as a diversion
success: Smokers will be referred from SSS to leisure provision
hic_label: Working in partnership is the building block for success

ap_title: Promote e-cigarettes as a safer and healthier alternative to smoking
ap_text: Promote e-cigarettes as a safer and healthier alternative to smoking. Work with Public Health 'approved' Vape Shops to give vouchers to bed bound clients
success: Increase in number of bed bound smokers using E-cigs instead of cigarettes
hic_label: Working in partnership is the building block for success

ap_title: Greater sharing of intelligence to Trading Standards
ap_text: Greater sharing of intelligence to Trading Standards
success: Increase of intel reports to Trading Standards
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_title: Enhanced maternity dataset
ap_text: Enhanced maternity dataset ensuring smoking status recorded for all pregnant women
success: All hospitals within the local LMS footprint collect and report data.
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_title: Improve data capturing from stop smoking services
ap_text: Improve data capturing from stop smoking services
success: Improved data quality to understand service delivery and  targeting
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_title: Produce smoking cessation gap analysis and action plan
ap_text: Produce smoking cessation gap analysis and action plan, based on NICE guidance (PH26) and CLeaR Assessment
success: Maternity systems demonstrate enhanced stop smoking support and pathways in line with NICE guidance and CLeaR Assessments
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_title: Report the number of people signposted
ap_text: Report on the number of people signposted to stop smoking services from wellbeing hubs
success: Awareness of local smoking population data collected and shared
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_title: Share data gathered from health MOTs
ap_text: Share data gathered from health MOTs to show the number of people identified as smokers
success: Awareness of local smoking population data collected and shared
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_title: Smoking status recorded for all pregnant women
ap_text: Smoking status of all pregnant women captured at time of booking and delivery (mandatory)
success: Accurate data recorded and shared
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_title: Quantify tobacco use by district, age ranges, and ethnicty
ap_text: Quantify tobacco use by district, age ranges, and ethnicty
success: Health4Families will be able to target groups to allow appropriate health messages
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control
Clarity required: Q. Is this data you gather that can be shared with others? If so the action needs to change to read share.

ap_title: Refresh the Health Equity Audit for stop smoking services
ap_text: Refresh the West Sussex Health Equit Audit for stop smoking services
success: Completed HEA used to inform service redseign
hic_label: Use tobacco control to tackle health inequalities

ap_title: Increase understanding of attitudes to smoking among Eastern Europeans
ap_text: Increase local understanding of attitudes towards smoking among Eastern Europeans in West Sussex
success: Approriate interventions developed based on insight
hic_label: Use tobacco control to tackle health inequalities

ap_title: Support with smokefree prisons
ap_text: Support  Ministry of Justice and Public Health England with smokefree prisons
success: Improved pathway for those being released from prison to support their smoking cessation
hic_label: Use tobacco control to tackle health inequalities

ap_title: Health4Families targetting tobacco related activity
ap_text: Target Health4Families tobacco related activity at young parents in areas of deprivation
success: Increase of young parents/people from deprived wards engaging with SSS
hic_label: Use tobacco control to tackle health inequalities

ap_title: Offer targetted workplace health (WPH) services
ap_text: Target businesses in deprived areas to offer workplace health (WPH) services
success: Increase in the number of smokers acessing SSS from workplaces deprived areas
hic_label: Use tobacco control to tackle health inequalities

ap_title: Improving links between prisons and community stop smoking services
ap_text: Build on national smokefree prisons programme by improving links with the community stop smoking services
success: A pathway to support those being released from prison estate to continue their stop smoking attempt
hic_label: Use tobacco control to tackle health inequalities

ap_title: Use 'Actively Quitting' pilot to target disadvantaged wards
ap_text: Use 'Actively Quitting' pilot to target disadvantaged wards
success: Smokers from disadvantaged wards will be referred from SSS to leisure provision
hic_label: Use tobacco control to tackle health inequalities

ap_title: Uptake of stop smoking services among substance misuse service users
ap_text: Work with substance misuse services to improve uptake of stop smoking services by service users
success: Improved pathway for those accesing substance misuse services to support their smoking cessation
hic_label: Use tobacco control to tackle health inequalities

ap_title: Actively participate in national and local tobacco control campaigns
ap_text: Actively participate in national and local tobacco control campaigns
success: Evaluation of campaign reach, which increases year on year
partners: Wellbeing programme, Health4Families, Trading Standards, District & Boroughs, Public Health
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Annual campaign community event
ap_text: Actively participate in national and local tobacco control campaigns through at least one annual campaign community event organised by 10 fire stations and through social media
success: Evaluation of campaign reach, which increases year on year
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Identify approaches that best serve different communities
ap_text: Identify approaches to disemminating smokefree messages that best serve different communities
success: Engagement with  BAME groups , particularly Eastern European to gain insight into attitudes towards tobacco use
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Lead on tobacco control communication and campaigns
ap_text: Lead on tobacco control communication and campaigns
success: A communication plan for the period of this strategy is produced
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Provide evidence based information via Family Assist
ap_text: Provision of evidence based and consistent information, including on smoking cessation, to all families across West Sussex, via an easily accessed and interactive digital platform (Family Assist)
success: Family Assist achieves high levels of engagement with mothers and families in the provision of comprehensive pre-conception guidance, including on stop smoking information
partners: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust, Sussex Community NHS Foundation Trust, West Sussex County Council
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Distribute 5,000 Safe and Well information booklets
ap_text: Distribute 5,000 Safe and Well information booklets to residents receiving a Safe and Well visit. Booklets include information on smoking related fires, how to make a home smoke free and where to go for smoking cessation support.
success: 5,000 booklets will be disctributed to vulnerable people in their homes
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Wellbeing programme that supports tobacco control
ap_text: Develop the role of the wellbeing programme to support tobacco control
success: West Sussex wellbeing programmes are more engaged in tobacco control
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Redesign stop smoking service provision in West Sussex
ap_text: Redesign stop smoking service provision in West Sussex
success: Effective stop smoking services reaching those that most need to access them
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Work with Vape shops to support stop smoking providers in primary care
ap_text: Work with Vape shops to support stop smoking providers
success: Improved quit rates. Increased comfidence in stop smoking providers to discuss vaping as a mtehod to quit tobacco
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Patients are asked about their use of tobacco at pre-assessment clinics
ap_text: All patients attending pre assessment clinic are asked about their use of tobacco. Smokers are given brief advice and signposted to local stop smoking services
success: Increase  in number of elective patients being signposted to stop smoking services
partners: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Develop a Patient Group Directive around Champix prescribing
ap_text: Develop a Patient Group Directive around Champix prescribing
success: Improved quit rates in pharmacy providers
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Improve quality of stop smoking service delivery
ap_text: Improve quality of stop smoking service delivery
success: Improved conversion rates
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Improved training offer for stop smoking services
ap_text: Improve training offer for providers of stop smoking services
success: Face to face training for new advisors in place and be spoke elearning package for top up training
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Referral and follow up to stop smoking services
ap_text: Referral and follow up to stop smoking services whether the stop smoking intervention is inhouse or external
success: Drop in number of pregnant women still smoking at time of delivery compared to booking
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Share data gathered from health MOTs
ap_text: Share data gathered from health MOTs to show the number of people identified as smokers who have been signposted/referred into SSS
success: Increase in referrals to SSS
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Test an integrated midwifery-led stop smoking service
ap_text: Test an integrated tier 2 midwifery led stop smoking support service
success: Increase in maternal quit rates between booking and delivery. Shared and integrated learning across Sussex and East Surrey Local Maternity Systems
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Preventing ill health from alcohol and tobacco CQUIN
ap_text: Support NHS achieve the preventing ill health from alcohol and tobacco CQUIN
success: Local NHS Trusts have achieved the CQUIN
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Training for primary care staff to deliver stop smoking services
ap_text: Provide training for primary care staff to deliver stop smoking services
success: Primary care staff are able to deliver stop smoking services
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Work with primary care service providers to improve services delivered
ap_text: Work with primary care service providers to improve quantity and quality of services delivered
success: More stop smoking services within primary care
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Home visiting staff trained in Make Every Contact Count (MECC)
ap_text: Train Prevention Team home visiting staff in Make Every Contact Count (MECC)
success: Staff will be more confident in having signposting conversations about smoking cessation and making a record
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Rollout Make Every Contact Count (MECC) to 30% of operational crews
ap_text: Work with the Fire and Rescue Training and Development team to roll out Make Every Contact Count (MECC) to 30% of operational crews
success: 30% of operational personnel will be more confident in having signposting conversations about smoking cessation and recording
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: A Local Maternity System (LMS) wide action plan
ap_text: A Local Maternity System (LMS) wide action plan will be developed
success: Plan developed for use by all organisations which are part of the local LMS.
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Carbon monoxide (CO) testing at antenatal appointments
ap_text: Carbon monoxide (CO) testing at antenatal appointments for all pregnant women
success: All Pregnant women attending antenatal appointments will be CO tested
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Training delivered to all HCP staff involved in the care of pregnant women
ap_text: Ensure training is delivered to all HCP staff involved in the care of pregnant women in the identification of smoking, delivery of smoking cessation advice and referring to smoking cessation services
success: Each organisation has training developed and available to relevant workforce.
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Explore how Dentists could support tobacco control
ap_text: Explore how Dentists could support tobacco control
success: Understand the views of dentists to support tobacco control
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Delivery of smoking brief advice to non-elective inpatients
ap_text: Improve the delivery of smoking brief advice to non elective inpatients
success: Non elective inpatients receive appropriate advice and support to stop smoking
partners: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Rollout Make Every Contact Count to clinical and non-clinical staff
ap_text: Rollout Make Every Contact Count (MECC) programme to clinical and non-clinical staff in healthcare settings such as primary care
success: Increased confidence of front line staff in raising the issue of smoking
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Signpost smokers to stop smoking services
ap_text: Signpost smokers to stop smoking services when conducting Safe and Well visits
success: Increase in the number of people accessing the SSS
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Health4Families staff training
ap_text: Health4Families staff to complete National Centre for Smoking Cessation and Training Very Brief Advice level 1 training.
success: 1. All staff will be VBA trained,            2. Staff will be confident to discuss smoking cessation and record conversation outcome
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control
Clarity required: Q. you mentioned that staff are audited every 6 months what does this mean and what is in the audit

ap_title: Wellbeing hub staff level 1 training
ap_text: Wellbeing hub staff to complete National Centre for Smoking Cessation and Training Very Brief Advice level 1 trianing.
success: 1. All wellbeing staff will be VBA trained,            2. Wellbeing staff will be confident to discuss smoking cessation and record conversation outcome
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Wellbeing hub staff level 2 training
ap_text: Wellbeing hub staff to complete National Centre for Smoking Cessation and Training Very Brief Advice level 2 trianing.
success: 1. All wellbeing staff will be VBA trained,            2. Wellbeing staff will be confident to discuss smoking cessation and record conversation outcome
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Midwives level 1 training
ap_text: Midwives to complete National Centre for Smoking Cessation and Training Very Brief Advice on smoking for pregnant women level 1 to talk about smoking cessation with pregnant women and their partners
success: 1. All midwives will be VBA trained,            2. Midwives will be confident to discuss smoking cessation and record conversation outcome
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Safe and Well visits to test individual levels of carbon monoxide
ap_text: Use carbon monoxide (CO) Monitors during Safe and Well Visits to test individual levels of CO
success: Identify people who have high levels of CO in their breath and to raise awareness of the impact from smoking
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Disrupt the supply of illicit tobacco
ap_text: Continue to disrupt the supply of illicit tobacco in West Sussex
success: More traders brought into  compliance, increase in numbes of seizures and quantities seized
hic_label: Tackle cheap and illicit tobacco
Clarity required: Q. Can any of these be broken down into short medium or long term or are they all S/M/L term?

ap_title: Educate consumers of illicit tobacco
ap_text: Educate consumers of issues with illicit tobacco and how to report it
success: Increase in intelligence and intel reported
hic_label: Tackle cheap and illicit tobacco
Clarity required: Q. Can any of these be broken down into short medium or long term or are they all S/M/L term?

ap_title: Clear reporting mechanisms for illicit tobacco among midwives
ap_text: If staff are aware that illicit tobacco is being used they know how to report
success: Increase in the number of IT reports to Trading Standards
partners: Maternity at Western Hospitals, Wellbeing programme, Health4Families
hic_label: Tackle cheap and illicit tobacco

ap_title: Review Smoke Free West Sussex Partnership membership
ap_text: Review Smoke Free West Sussex Partnership membership
success: A partnership that actively discusses and addresses through working together the tobacco issues in West Sussex
hic_label: Influence change through advocacy

ap_title: CLeaR deep dive
ap_text: Complete a CLeaR model (Challenge, Leadership and Results) deep dive for Smokefree West Sussex
success: Recommendations to develop SFWSP
hic_label: Influence change through advocacy

ap_title: Link messages into community and voluntary sector organsiations
ap_text: Link messages regarding tobacco control into community and voluntary sector organsiations
success: Communities team raise tobacco control at a minimum of two events per year
hic_label: Influence change through advocacy

ap_title: Link tobacco control messages into directorate team meetings
ap_text: Link messages regarding tobacco control into directorate team meetings
success: Tobacco control raised at a mnimum of two  C&PP directorate management team meetings a year
hic_label: Influence change through advocacy

ap_title: Raise the issue of tobacco control in West Sussex
ap_text: Support members and the Director of Public Health in West Sussex to raise the issue of tobacco control
success: Whole system approaches to tobacco control embedded  and health in all policies include tobacco control
hic_label: Influence change through advocacy

ap_title: Under age sales operations on intel led targets
ap_text: Continue to undertake under age sales operations on intel led targets
success: Reduction in 'hit rates' of sales in UAS operations
hic_label: Helping young people to be tobacco free
Clarity required: Q. Can any of these be broken down into short medium or long term or are they all S/M/L term?

ap_title: Educating businesses in under age sales legislation
ap_text: Educate businesses in West Sussex in under age sales legislation
success: Increased number of businesses with knowledge of UAS legislation and engagment with TS
hic_label: Helping young people to be tobacco free
Clarity required: Q. Can any of these be broken down into short medium or long term or are they all S/M/L term?

ap_title: Understanding attitudes to smoking among young people in West Sussex
ap_text: Increase local understanding of attitudes to smoking of young people in West Sussex
success: Approriate interventions developed based on insight
hic_label: Helping young people to be tobacco free

ap_title: Signpost Health4Families service users to stop smoking services
ap_text: Referring young people who use Health4Families who are smokers to stop smoking services
success: Increase number of young people engaging with stop smoking services
hic_label: Helping young people to be tobacco free

ap_title: Support the Local Maternity System
ap_text: Support the Local Maternity System to achieve its aspirations related to tobacco control
success: LMS has achieved its aspirations
hic_label: Helping young people to be tobacco free

ap_title: Young parents care pathway
ap_text: Use young parents care pathway as an opportunity to advise on health messages
success: Fewer young parents smoking at time of delivery
hic_label: Helping young people to be tobacco free

ap_title: Investigate efficacy of interventions for young people
ap_text: Investigate efficacy of prevention and smoking cessation interventions for young people
success: Awareness of appropriate interventions for preventing the uptake of smoking among young people as well as helping them stop. This will be through a review of published and grey literature and other social research methods.
hic_label: Helping young people to be tobacco free

ap_title: Local Maternity System knowledgebase
ap_text: Information on effects of smoking/smoking cessation services/smoke free homes included on LMS knowledgebase.
success: Increase in visits/hits to knowledgebase per year.
hic_label: Maintain and promote smoke free enviornments

ap_title: Nicotine Replacement Therapy available during hospital stay
ap_text: Nicotine Replacement Therapy (NRT) to be available to all pregnant women during hospital stay
success: An increase in the number of pregnant women on NRT during their hospital stay
hic_label: Maintain and promote smoke free enviornments

ap_title: Review workplace smokefree policies for local authorities
ap_text: Review the smokefree policy for local authorities
success: Evidence based workplace policy in WSCC
hic_label: Maintain and promote smoke free enviornments

ap_title: Health4Families Smokfree policy
ap_text: Develop a Smokfree policy for all service buildings and areas staff can use whilst at work
success: All Children and family centres adhere to smokefree policy
hic_label: Maintain and promote smoke free enviornments
Clarity required: Q. is there a policy already in place, what specifically is the action/objective here?

ap_title: Promoting smokefree environments outside maternity units
ap_text: Training staff to maintain and promote smokefree environments outside maternity unit
success: Smoke Free maternity grounds
hic_label: Maintain and promote smoke free enviornments

ap_title: Planning and licensing processes promoting smokefree environments
ap_text: Explore how planning and licensing processes in local authorities can be utilised to promote  smokefree environments
success: Smoke Free environments promoted
hic_label: Maintain and promote smoke free enviornments
